subject: Re: [junit] Testing a Service with JUnit
msgSnippet: Do the tests and the service need to run in the same process? If not, manually start the service process, then run the tests. Alternatively, why not just call

Do the tests and the service need to run in the same process? If not,
manually start the service process, then run the tests.

Alternatively, why not just call MyService.main() to get you going? No
law against it.

Best case is to remove the dependency on calling main(), refactoring to
a design that allows you to write new MyService().go().

Good luck.

So said  Rohrbach, William A.  on  2003-01-08 --------------------

>I am trying to run some JUnit tests against a service that is started
via
>the main() method. This process must be started before I can run my
JUnit
>test cases. How do I go about starting that service and then running
the
>test cases against the running service? Do I use the setUp() method to
>start
>a thread to run the service and then run my test cases?
>
>Thanks,
>Bill
